May

  1. Moana – 2016 (PG)

    In Ancient Polynesia, when a terrible curse incurred by the Demigod Maui reaches Moana's island, she answers the Ocean's call to seek out the Demigod to set things right.

    • Date: Fri May 25
    • Venue: Randall's Island Park

  2. Top Gun – 1986 (PG)

    As students at the United States Navy's elite fighter weapons school compete to be best in the class, one daring young pilot learns a few things from a civilian instructor that are not taught in the classroom.

    • Date: Fri May 25
    • Venue: Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum

  4. The Lorax – 2012 (PG)

    A 12-year-old boy searches for the one thing that will enable him to win the affection of the girl of his dreams. To find it he must discover the story of the Lorax, the grumpy yet charming creature who fights to protect his world.

    • Date: Sat Jun 2
    • Venue: Westerleigh Park

    • Date: Sat Jun 2

    In Miami in 1980, a determined Cuban immigrant takes over a drug cartel and succumbs to greed.

    • Date: Mon Sep 3
    • Venue: Azul Rooftop @ Hotel Hugo

  2. Inglourious Basterds – 2009 (R)

    In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.

    • Date: Thu Sep 6
    • Venue: Rooftop Reds

  3. The Grocer’s Son – 2007 (N/A)

    Antoine Sforza, a thirty-year-old young man, left his village ten years before in order to start a new life in the big city, but now that his father, a traveling grocer, is in hospital ...

    • Date: Thu Sep 6
    • Venue: Van Am Rotunda

  4. Get Out – 2017 (R)

    A young African-American visits his white girlfriend's parents for the weekend, where his simmering uneasiness about their reception of him eventually reaches a boiling point.

    • Date: Sun Sep 9
    • Venue: Coney Island Beach
  5. No poster available

    Rogue One: A Star Wars Story – 2016 (PG-13)

    The daughter of an Imperial scientist joins the Rebel Alliance in a risky move to steal the Death Star plans.

    • Date: Sun Sep 9
    • Venue: Randalls Island Baseball Field #42

  6. Funny Face – 1957

    An impromptu fashion shoot at a book store brings about a new fashion model discovery in the shop clerk.

    • Date: Mon Sep 10
    • Venue: Azul Rooftop @ Hotel Hugo

  7. Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery – 1997 (PG-13)

    A 1960s hipster secret agent is brought out of cryofreeze to oppose his greatest enemy in the 1990s, where his social attitudes are glaringly out of place.

    • Date: Thu Sep 13
    • Venue: Rooftop Reds

  8. The Last Dragon – 1985 (PG-13)

    In New York City, a young man searches for the "master" to obtain the final level of martial arts mastery known as the glow. Along the way, he must fight a martial arts expert corrupted ...

    • Date: Fri Sep 14
    • Venue: Parade Ground

  9. Ratatouille – 2007 (G)

    A rat who can cook makes an unusual alliance with a young kitchen worker at a famous restaurant.

    • Date: Sat Sep 15
    • Venue: Hunter's Point South Park

  10. Big Night – 1996 (R)

    A failing Italian restaurant run by two brothers gambles on one special night to try to save the business.

    • Date: Mon Sep 17
    • Venue: Azul Rooftop @ Hotel Hugo

  11. So I Married an Axe Murderer – 1993 (PG-13)

    A San Francisco poet who fears commitment suspects his girlfriend may have a knack for killing off her significant others.

    • Date: Thu Sep 20
    • Venue: Rooftop Reds
  12. No poster available

    Coco – 2017 (PG)

    Aspiring musician Miguel, confronted with his family's ancestral ban on music, enters the Land of the Dead to find his great-great-grandfather, a legendary singer.

    • Date: Mon Sep 24
    • Venue: Azul Rooftop @ Hotel Hugo

  13. Wayne’s World – 1992 (PG-13)

    Two slacker friends try to promote their public-access cable show.

    • Date: Thu Sep 27
    • Venue: Rooftop Reds

October

  1. Hocus Pocus – 1993 (PG)

    After three centuries, three witch sisters are resurrected in Salem, Massachusetts on Halloween night, and it is up to two teenagers, a young girl, and an immortal cat to put an end to their reign of terror once and for all.

    • Date: Mon Oct 1
    • Venue: Rooftop Reds

  2. The Shining – 1980 (R)

    A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where an evil spiritual presence influences the father into violence, while his psychic son sees horrific forebodings from the past and of the future.

    • Date: Mon Oct 1
    • Venue: Azul Rooftop @ Hotel Hugo

  3. Halloween – 1978 (R)

    Fifteen years after murdering his sister on Halloween night 1963, Michael Myers escapes from a mental hospital and returns to the small town of Haddonfield to kill again.

    • Date: Mon Oct 8
    • Venue: Azul Rooftop @ Hotel Hugo

  4. Scream – 1996 (R)

    A year after the murder of her mother, a teenage girl is terrorized by a new killer, who targets the girl and her friends by using horror films as part of a deadly game.

    • Date: Thu Oct 11
    • Venue: Rooftop Reds

  5. Nightmare on Elm Street – 1984 (R)

    Several people are hunted by a cruel serial killer who kills his victims in their dreams. While the survivors are trying to find the reason for being chosen, the murderer won't lose any chance to kill them as soon as they fall asleep.

    • Date: Thu Oct 25
    • Venue: Rooftop Reds

  6. The Amityville Horror – 2005 (R)

    Newlyweds are terrorized by demonic forces after moving into a large house that was the site of a grisly mass murder a year before.

    • Date: Wed Oct 31
    • Venue: Rooftop Reds
